Permissions¶

Resource Operation Description
Permission GET /permissions View available permissions.
UserClass POST /user_classes Create new user class.
  GET /user_classes View multiple user classes.
  DELETE /user_classes/(int:user_class_id) Delete user class.
  PUT /user_classes/(int:user_class_id) Modify existing user class.
  GET /user_classes/(int:user_class_id) View a user class.

Permissions¶

GET /permissions¶

View all permissions available. Requires the modify_permissions permission.

Example response:

{
  "status": "success",
  "response": [
    "list_permissions",
    "modify_permissions",
    "change_password"
  ]
}
Response JSON Object:
 
  • response (list) – A list of permission name strings
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK – View successful
  • 403 Forbidden – User lacks sufficient permissions to view permissions

User Classes¶

POST /user_classes¶

Create a new user class. Requires the modify_user_classes permission.

Example request:

POST /user_classes HTTP/1.1

{
  "name": "user_v2",
  "permissions": [
    "send_invites",
    "change_password"
  ]
}

Example response:

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Vary: Accept
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "status": "success",
  "response": "<UserClass> or <SecondaryUserClass>"
}
JSON Parameters:
 
  • name (string) – Name of the user class
  • permissions (list) – A list of permissions encoded as strings
  • secondary (boolean) – Whether or not to create a secondary or primary class (Default False)
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK – User class successfully created
  • 400 Bad Request – User class name taken or invalid permissions
GET /user_classes¶

View all available user classes and their associated permission sets. Requires the list_user_classes permission.

Example response:

{
  "status": "success",
  "response": [
    "<UserClass or SecondaryUserClass>",
    "<UserClass or SecondaryUserClass>"
  ]
}
Query Parameters:
 
  • secondary (boolean) – Whether or not to view secondary or primary user classes
Response JSON Object:
 
  • response (list) – A list of user classes
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK – View successful
  • 404 Not Found – User class does not exist
DELETE /user_classes/(int: user_class_id)¶

Create a new user class. Requires the modify_user_classes permission.

Example request:

PUT /user_classes HTTP/1.1

{
  "name": "user_v2"
}

Example response:

{
  "status": "success",
  "response": "UserClass user_v2 has been deleted."
}
Query Parameters:
 
  • secondary (boolean) – Whether or not to delete a secondary or primary user class
JSON Parameters:
 
  • name (string) – Name of the user class
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK – Userclass successfully deleted
  • 400 Bad Request – Unable to delete user class
  • 404 Not Found – Userclass does not exist
PUT /user_classes/(int: user_class_id)¶

Modifies permissions for an existing user class. Requires the modify_user_classes permission.

Example request:

PUT /user_classes/user HTTP/1.1

{
  "permissions": {
    "send_invites": false,
    "change_password": true,
    "list_permissions": true
  }
}

Example response:

{
  "status": "success",
  "response": "<UserClass> or <SecondaryUserClass>"
}
Response JSON Object:
 
  • permissions (dict) – A dictionary of permissions to add/remove, with the permission name as the key and a boolean (True = add, False = remove) as the value.
  • secondary (boolean) – Whether or not to modify a secondary or primary user class
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK – Userclass successfully modified
  • 400 Bad Request – Permissions cannot be applied
  • 404 Not Found – Userclass does not exist
GET /user_classes/(int: user_class_id)¶

View an available user class and its associated permission sets. Requires the list_user_classes permission.

Example response:

{
  "status": "success",
  "response": "<UserClass> or <SecondaryUserClass>"
}
Query Parameters:
 
  • secondary (boolean) – Whether or not to view a secondary or primary user class
Status Codes:
  • 200 OK – View successful
